verses.verse: Send <WH7971> ye the lambs<WH3733> for the ruler<WH4910> of the land<WH776> from Selah<WH5554> to the wilderness<WH4057>, unto the mount<WH2022> of the daughter<WH1323> of Zion<WH6726>.
For it shall be that<WH5074>, as wandering birds<WH5775>, as a scattered<WH7971> nest<WH7064>, so shall the daughters<WH1323> of Moab<WH4124> be at the fords<WH4569> of the Arnon<WH769>.

Give counsel<WH6098>, execute<WH6213> justice<WH6415>; make<WH7896> thy shade<WH6738> as the night<WH3915> in the midst<WH8432> of the noonday<WH6672>; hide<WH5641> the outcasts<WH5080>; betray not the fugitive<WH5074>.

Let mine outcasts<WH5080> dwell<WH1481> with thee<WH4124>; as for Moab, be<WH1933> thou a covert<WH5643> to him from the face<WH6440> of the destroyer<WH7703>. For the extortioner<WH4160> is brought to nought<WH656>, destruction<WH7701> ceaseth<WH3615>, the oppressors<WH7429> are consumed<WH8552> out of the land<WH776>.

And a throne<WH3678> shall be established<WH3559> in lovingkindness<WH2617>; and one shall sit<WH3427> thereon in truth<WH571>, in the tent<WH168> of David<WH1732>, judging<WH8199>, and seeking<WH1875> justice<WH4941>, and swift<WH4106> to do righteousness<WH6664>.

We have heard<WH8085> of the pride<WH1347> of Moab<WH4124>, that he is very<WH3966> proud<WH1341>; even of his arrogancy<WH1346>, and his pride<WH1347>, and his wrath<WH5678>; his boastings are nought<WH907>.
Therefore shall Moab<WH4124> wail<WH3213> for Moab<WH4124>, every one shall wail<WH3213>: for the raisin-cakes<WH808> of Kir-hareseth<WH7025> shall ye mourn<WH1897>, utterly stricken<WH5218>.

For the fields<WH7709> of Heshbon<WH2809> languish<WH535>, and the vine<WH1612> of Sibmah<WH7643>; the lords<WH1167> of the nations<WH1471> have broken down<WH1986> the choice branches<WH8291> thereof<WH5060>, which reached even unto Jazer<WH3270>, which wandered<WH8582> into the wilderness<WH4057>; its shoots<WH7976> were spread abroad<WH5203>, they passed over<WH5674> the sea<WH3220>.

Therefore I will weep<WH1058> with the weeping<WH1065> of Jazer<WH3270> for the vine<WH1612> of Sibmah<WH7643>; I will water<WH7301> thee with my tears<WH1832>, O Heshbon<WH2809>, and Elealeh<WH500>: for upon thy summer fruits<WH7019> and upon thy harvest<WH7105> the battle shout<WH1959> is fallen<WH5307>.

And gladness<WH8057> is taken away<WH622>, and joy<WH1524> out of the fruitful field<WH3759>; and in the vineyards<WH3754> there shall be no singing<WH7442>, neither joyful noise<WH7321>: no treader<WH1869> shall tread out<WH1869> wine<WH3196> in the presses<WH3342>; I have made the vintage shout<WH1959> to cease<WH7673>.
Wherefore my heart<WH4578> soundeth<WH1993> like a harp<WH3658> for Moab<WH4124>, and mine inward parts<WH7130> for Kir-heres<WH7025>.

And it shall come to pass<WH4124>, when Moab presenteth<WH7200> himself<WH3811>, when he wearieth himself upon the high place<WH1116>, and shall come<WH935> to his sanctuary<WH4720> to pray<WH6419>, that he shall not prevail<WH3201>.
This is the word<WH1697> that Jehovah<WH3068> spake<WH1696> concerning Moab<WH4124> in time past<WH227>.

But now Jehovah<WH3068> hath spoken<WH1696>, saying<WH559>, Within three<WH7969> years<WH8141>, as the years<WH8141> of a hireling<WH7916>, the glory<WH3519> of Moab<WH4124> shall be brought into contempt<WH7034>, with all his great<WH7227> multitude<WH1995>; and the remnant<WH7605> shall be very<WH4592> small<WH4213> and of no account<WH3808>.
